function.name: create_automation_routine
function.description: If the input asks to automate or optimize devices, the home, or specific locations based on price or comfort.  Assume utility prices are available
examples: - Optimize my lights and pool pump
- Can you automate my Batmobile based on utility prices?
- Can you optimize my Ecobee - Thermostat based on utility prices?
- Optimize my home (or house) based on utility prices
- Automate my house Room Hue based on energy prices

original_input.description: The full customer input, for reference and traceability

reasoning.description: The LLM reasoning for the automation or optimization routine, if applicable

function.name: command_device
function.description: Sends a command to a specific device or group of devices. If the command is not recognized, it will send back an error message
examples: - Turn on the lights in the living room
- Can you turn off the coffee maker?
- Dim the lights in the bedroom
- Can you turn off the TV?

device_id.description: The unique identifier of the device to be controlled

command_id.description: The command id to be sent to the device. For example, 'DON' for 'turn on', 'DOF' for 'turn off', 'SET' for 'set value', etc.

command_params.description: The parameters for the command, such as value, level, or any other specific command details

param_uom.description: The unit of measure for the parameter, if applicable

param_precision.description: The precision of the value, if applicable

customer_input.description: The full customer input without any modifications
